getItemAlignmentFocusViewId().Description: Returns Id of which child view take focus for alignment. When not set, it will use use same id of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentViewId_E@

isItemAlignmentOffsetWithPadding().Description: Returns true if applies padding to item alignment when @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentOffsetPercent_E@ is 0 or 100; returns false otherwise. When true: Applies start/top padding when @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentOffsetPercent_E@ is 0. Applies end/bottom padding when @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentOffsetPercent_E@ is 100. Does not apply padding if @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentOffsetPercent_E@ is neither 0 nor 100. When false: does not apply padding

getItemAlignmentViewId().Description: Returns Id of which child view to be aligned. View.NO_ID refers to root view and should be only used in first one. Different view ids of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet_E@ define multiple alignment steps within one itemView, e.g. there are two child views R.id.child1 and R.id.child2. App may allocated two @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef_E@s, one with view id R.id.child1, the other with view id R.id.child2. Note this id may or may not be same as the child view that takes focus.

Parameters: boolean: Boolean indicating whether to align to view baseline.
setAlignedToTextViewBaseline(boolean).Description: When true, align to @B_android#view#View#getBaseline_E@ for the view of with id equals @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentViewId_E@; false otherwise.

Parameters: int: The id of child view that will be focused to.
setItemAlignmentFocusViewId(int).Description: Sets Id of which child view take focus for alignment. When not set, it will use use same id of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentViewId_E@.

setItemAlignmentOffsetPercent(float).Description: Sets the offset percent for item alignment in addition to offset. E.g., 40 means 40% of width/height from the low edge. In the right to left case, it's the 40% width from right edge. Use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ITEM_ALIGN_OFFSET_PERCENT_DISABLED_E@ to disable.

getItemAlignmentOffsetPercent().Description: Gets the offset percent for item alignment in addition to offset. E.g., 40 means 40% of the width from the low edge. In the right to left case, it's the 40% from right edge. Use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ITEM_ALIGN_OFFSET_PERCENT_DISABLED_E@ to disable.

Parameters: int: The id of child view that will be aligned to.
setItemAlignmentViewId(int).Description: Sets Id of which child view to be aligned. View.NO_ID refers to root view and should be only used in first one. Different view ids of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet_E@ define multiple alignment steps within one itemView, e.g. there are two child views R.id.child1 and R.id.child2. App may allocated two @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef_E@s, one with view id R.id.child1, the other with view id R.id.child2. Note this id may or may not be same as the child view that takes focus.

setItemAlignmentOffsetWithPadding(boolea.Description: Sets whether applies padding to item alignment when @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentOffsetPercent_E@ is 0 or 100. When true: Applies start/top padding if @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentOffsetPercent_E@ is 0. Applies end/bottom padding if @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentOffsetPercent_E@ is 100. Does not apply padding if @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#ItemAlignmentFacet#ItemAlignmentDef#getItemAlignmentOffsetPercent_E@ is neither 0 nor 100. When false: does not apply padding

Returns: Number of pixels to the end of low edge.
getItemAlignmentOffset().Description: Returns number of pixels to the end of low edge. Supports right to left layout direction. In left to right or vertical case, it's the offset added to left/top edge. In right to left case, it's the offset subtracted from right edge.

Parameters: int: In left to right or vertical case, it's the offset added to left/top edge. In right to left case, it's the offset subtracted from right edge.
setItemAlignmentOffset(int).Description: Sets number of pixels to the end of low edge. Supports right to left layout direction.

isAlignedToTextViewBaseLine().Description: Returns true when View should be aligned to @B_android#view#View#getBaseline_E@

ClassDesc: Definition of an alignment position under a view.
